Custom Forms and Scrollbars

This script allows to style form elements and create custom scroll bars. The following elements are supported: custom scroll bars, <select>, <input type="radio">, <input type="checkbox">, <input type="file">, <textarea>. To prevent some element from customizing put the "default" class on it.

Initialization of the script:

To use the script copy the code from this page. Disabling one of the modules in the script disables the customization of its elements.

1. First of all you need to connect the jcf.js file. It is the base of the rest of scripts. Do this the following way in HTML:

		<script type="text/javascript" src="js/jcf.js"></script>                   <!-- main script - the connection is obligatory -->
		<script type="text/javascript" src="js/jcf.scrollable.js"></script>        <!-- custom scroll bars module -->
		<script type="text/javascript" src="js/jcf.checkbox.js"></script>          <!-- custom checkboxes module -->
		<script type="text/javascript" src="js/jcf.radio.js"></script>             <!-- custom radio buttons module -->
		<script type="text/javascript" src="js/jcf.select.js"></script>            <!-- custom selects module (custom scrolls connect optionally) -->
		<script type="text/javascript" src="js/jcf.select.multiple.js"></script>   <!-- custom multiple selects module -->
		<script type="text/javascript" src="js/jcf.textarea.js"></script>          <!-- custom textarea module (needs the connection of custom scroll bars module) -->
		<script type="text/javascript" src="js/jcf.file.js"></script>              <!-- custom input type file module -->

2. Custom forms function is called after the connection of the rest of previous scripts:

		<script type="text/javascript">
			// replace all the custom elements after loading the page
			jcf.lib.domReady(function(){
				jcf.customForms.replaceAll();
			});
		</script>

3. When you make sure that all scripts work fine you can write down the content of all of them in a one file, accordingly the order of their connection.

To understand the work of different scripts try to disable them one by one and see the result on a page in a browser.

The example of custom scroll bars connection only:

		<!-- the example of custom scroll bars connection only -->
		<script type="text/javascript" src="js/jcf.js"></script>
		<script type="text/javascript" src="js/jcf.scrollable.js"></script>
		<script type="text/javascript">
			// replace all the custom elements after loading the page
			jcf.lib.domReady(function(){
				jcf.customForms.replaceAll();
			});
		</script>
